A quick fanart while I wait for this to happen in-game.

I love slow builds but I really want to see something happen between Jester and Fjord, even more so now that the captain’s is being all flirty with Fjord.

Let me know what you think!

summary:
I finally got the burr up my ass to cosplay Yasha from Critical Role. 
To celebrate my second year recovering from spinal...
body:
Today, my before pictures.

I finally got the burr up my ass to cosplay Yasha from Critical Role.

To celebrate my second year recovering from spinal meningitis, and the fact that I am finally well enough to go back to muscle building (I have spent most of two years resting or maintaining), I am starting a 7 month build. I have no specific goals as far as weight or size, as I am still sort of relearning my body and strength, but I hope to beef up my arms, shoulders, and legs.

Here is Yasha… @siriusdraws did this glorious lady.

And here are my before pics from today.

Super photogenic yo.

Here is Yasha… @siriusdraws did this glorious lady.

And here are my before pics from today.

summary: Listen guys I really want to draw some characters OTHER than Scanlan— really I do. But he keeps doing freaking amazing things...
caption:
Listen guys I really want to draw some characters OTHER than Scanlan— really I do. But he keeps doing freaking amazing things that inspire the hell out of me. Like, you know… summon a GIANT BULL DEMON 20 TIMES HIS HEIGHT DURING A SLEETSTORM AND STRAIGHT UP DOMINATING IT?

So until he either dies or impossibly starts being lame, this is what you be getting, k? K.

summary: I’m not a fan of “Most Valuable Player” as a concept anyway but I find it exceptionally stupid when it comes to Critical Role...
body:
I’m not a fan of “Most Valuable Player” as a concept anyway but I find it exceptionally stupid when it comes to Critical Role because most of the best fight moments happen when at least two characters move together for a combined attack.

I’m also a huge hypocrite because in my heart of heart I absolutely believe Laura Bailey, Marisha Ray and Ash-o-lee Johnson share the MVP spot in each and every fight they participate in.

summary: Matt, a year ago: Campaign 2 will be different from campaign 1, and set much later -- and we’ll reference campaign 1 as little...
body:
Matt, a year ago: Campaign 2 will be different from campaign 1, and set much later – and we’ll reference campaign 1 as little as possible, because we want everything to be separate.

Me, a year ago: Oh, that’s good! That means it’ll be friendly for newcomers, and I can finally get my friends into it.

Me, now: (slamming my hands on the table) What happened to Zahra and Kash? What is their kid like? What are Percy and Vex up to in Whitestone? How many of the quarter elves have been born now? What are they like? Is Cassandra a pro hunter yet? Are her and Kynan still friends? HOW IS KYNAN DOING JUST IN GENERAL? Has Grog learned how to read? Did Kaylie graduate from the academy? Where are Pike and Scanlan? Did they join the others and have little gnome babies? Is JB Trickfoot still living in Whitestone? Did Allura and Kima settle down somewhere? IS GILMORE HAPPY AND DOING WELL? Did his store franchise take off? What about Tary? Are we going to hear about his adventuring squad? Did Hunin and Odessa end up hookin up? WHAT HAPPENED TO VELORA TELL ME EVERYTHING ABOUT HER ENTIRE LIFE– (continues on for 2 hours)

blog.name: lostsometime
blog.title: I Lost Some Time Once...
blog.description: It's always in the last place you look for it.

summary: A line from the blood hunter info on dndbeyond:  “Creatures that do not have blood in their bodies are immune to blood curses.”...
body:
A line from the blood hunter info on dndbeyond:  “Creatures that do not have blood in their bodies are immune to blood curses.”

I am so upset we never got to see them play with this on critrole. Can you imagine? Like, the fight in the Sluice Weave, with the water elemental??? Taliesen/Molly trying to blind the elemental and then - shit! fuck! it doesn’t have any fucking blood!!

reblog.comment:

tags: of course matt can be the ninth member
but this interpretation fits better with how the group is evolving
summary: I was thinking today about the group’s name, the Mighty Nein, and its play on the number and the Zemnian word, and... well, it’s...
body:
I was thinking today about the group’s name, the Mighty Nein, and its play on the number and the Zemnian word, and… well, it’s getting eerily ring as the game goes on.

At the beginning, they were 7 (Fjord, Beau, Jester, Caleb, Nott, Molly and Yasha). And they often joked on the other two members “missing” when explaining the thing to stranger. Then Molly died and Caduceus joined the party, which you think about it, brought the number up to 8. Molly is still playing a role in their team, albeit in spirit only for now. The others haven’t forgotten about him and are still bringing his legacy with them. (For now this looks more evident with Beau and Nott, but we haven’t yet seen how it has fully affected the others.) Which means, they are -1 from being, fully, the Mighty Nein/9.

And however the story plays out, they will complete it.

If someone else dies, another character will join and Molly’s situation will repeat itself.

But if no one else dies (and of course we hope so), the missing member of the Mighty Nein could actually be… all the people that, in turn, joined and will join the M9 in their journey. Poetically, that missing place in their group will always stay open to whoever wants to help or needs a hand. Every person in the world will be the ninth member of the Mighty Nein.

Then Molly died and Caduceus joined the party, which you think about it, brought the number up to 8. Molly is still playing a role in their team, albeit in spirit only for now. The others haven’t forgotten about him and are still bringing his legacy with them. (For now this looks more evident with Beau and Nott, but we haven’t yet seen how it has fully affected the others.) Which means, they are -1 from being, fully, the Mighty Nein/9.

If someone else dies, another character will join and Molly’s situation will repeat itself.

But if no one else dies (and of course we hope so), the missing member of the Mighty Nein could actually be… all the people that, in turn, joined and will join the M9 in their journey. Poetically, that missing place in their group will always stay open to whoever wants to help or needs a hand. Every person in the world will be the ninth member of the Mighty Nein.

blog.name: lafontastic
blog.title: Supergirl has taken over my life
blog.description: Hey there! My name's Ashlee. She/her. My life revolves around the Harry Potter series, and my current obsessions include Critical Role, Blindspot, and Supergirl.
